page.title: 05FORESTRY
page.content: The Chilterns are noted for their {FORESTRY}schemes. There are planned {FELLING & replanting}cycles for deciduous trees,for timber.GRANTS are available from the Forestry Commission Dedication II for plantations under 25 yrs. Conifers act as a nurse-crop for the hardwoods: Oak, Beech, Larch & Cherry & provide interim income. Trees are thinned after 18-20 yrs, then every 5 yrs. Muntjac Deer damage the young Cherry (furniture trade) & harm the young Oak. Felling & replanting is done at a rate of 2 acres/yr. Herts.TREE Scheme is run by the County Landscape Group. They offer advice on all aspects of the timber trade & conservation. Free trees are given to those who will plant their own.A roadside hedge on Mr Baldwin's farm in Nettleden has been planted with trees from this scheme.
